description:
Request for "Keep-Alive" header to be added to outbound HTTP headers for NwHIN messages. A test ear was provided to SSA to clarify the desired results and a confirmation from SSA was provided to the CONNECT team:

-------------------------------------------
FYI, we installed new CONNECT Keep-Alive fix ear in one of our development environment and unit tested it. We are seeing new Keep-Alive attribute in the headers for all the transactions we use.

PatientDiscovery (Outbound)
DocumentQuery (Outbound/Inbound) 
RetrieveDocument (Outbound/Inbound)

Before Keep-Alive fix in place: Headers: {Accept=[*/*]}

After Keep-Alive fix in place: Headers: {Accept=[*/*], Connection=[Keep-Alive]}
-------------------------------------------

CC:
* Integrate new feature into connect_integration as well as 4.5.2-RC1 branch
* Add new custom properties inside gateway.propeties to configure keep-alive feature on and off.
* If keep-alive tag is passed inside the assertion block, it will override the default properties inside gateway.properties.
* if Keep-alive value > 1, it will turn on keep-alive feature.  otherwise, it will keep it off by default.
* Implement repsonsde gatway to detect keep-alive header. If configure inside adapter properties, the system will pass keep-alive to the reference adapter.  Otherwise, it will be off by default.
* Research to see if we can turn on and off feature without restarting the server when modify default properties.
Create a manual test plan as part of this ticket

QA:
* Make sure the keep-alive turns on in the server log if keep-alive tags exists in the entity layer.
* Validation Suites pass.
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want CONNECT to include a Keep-Alive option to bypass proxy server timeout issues

description:
Connect Team,

We are running into intermittent issues where the CONNECT 4.5.1 Gateway is returning the below document retrieve response. This is happening when we conduct capacity testing and we do not know why the response includes the following error "Unsupported guidance for API level". 

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"><soap:Header><Action xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:entitydocretrieve:RespondingGateway_CrossGatewayRetrieveResponseMessage</Action><MessageID xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">urn:uuid:a912e7dd-324e-4132-a2dd-1138fca19651</MessageID><To xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing/anonymous</To><RelatesTo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">urn:uuid:6a562c5e-c041-4b56-994e-52e44d64f35b</RelatesTo></soap:Header><soap:Body><ns17:RetrieveDocumentSetResponse xmlns:ns10="urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:common:subscriptionb2overridefordocuments" xmlns:ns11="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsrf/bf-2" xmlns:ns12="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsn/t-1" xmlns:ns13="urn:oasis:names:tc:emergency:EDXL:DE:1.0" xmlns:ns14="http://www.hhs.gov/healthit/nhin/cdc" xmlns:ns15="urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:common:subscriptionb2overrideforcdc" xmlns:ns16="http://nhinc.services.com/schema/auditmessage" xmlns:ns17="urn:ihe:iti:xds-b:2007" xmlns:ns18="http://www.caqh.org/SOAP/WSDL/CORERule2.2.0.xsd" xmlns:ns2="urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:common:nhinccommon" xmlns:ns3="urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:common:nhinccommonentity" xmlns:ns4="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:rim:3.0" xmlns:ns5="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:rs:3.0" xmlns:ns6="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:query:3.0" xmlns:ns7="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:lcm:3.0" xmlns:ns8="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing" xmlns:ns9="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsn/b-2"><ns5:RegistryResponse status="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:ResponseStatusType:Failure"><ns5:RegistryErrorList><ns5:RegistryError codeContext="Unsupported guidance for API level." errorCode="XDSRepositoryError" location="Entity Document Retrieve LEVEL_a0" severity="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:ErrorSeverityType:Error"/></ns5:RegistryErrorList></ns5:RegistryResponse></ns17:RetrieveDocumentSetResponse></soap:Body></soap:Envelope>
title: Problems with CONNECT 4.5.1 under load

description:
Adam Rabinowitz from ManTech has reported the following:

From: Rabinowitz, Adam [mailto:Adam.Rabinowitz@ManTech.com] 
Sent: Thursday, October 20, 2016 11:06 AM
Subject: New Issue with CONNECT 4.5.1--> The CONNECT 4.5.1 is intermittently throwing document query errors when we run load tests in passthrough mode

Hi CONNECT Team,

I tried opening a ticket through your JIRA system and I’m having problems accessing it again. Can you please open a ticket for me? We are running Perforamce tests using CONNECT 4.3.1 to simulate inbound eHealth Exchange requests from an external partner to the DoD DES system. We are seeing intermittent timeout errors reported in the CONNECT logs and these errors do not appear on the DES system so it seems to be a problem with CONNECT 4.3.1 under load. Below is the exception. Can you please open a ticket and assist us? Thanks!

description:
Currently, CONNECT cannot be built using JDK 8.  One solution is to update the libraries used for bytecode manipulation, unit testing, and object mocking.  Doing so carries many advantages, most notably:

    - Hibernate 5.1.0, which CONNECT upgraded to in 4.7, relies on javassist 3.20.0-GA by default.  By aligning the actual and expected versions, it reduces the risk associated with upgrading other framework libraries that rely on (or complement) javassist
    - CONNECT developers gain access to additional assertions and more powerful matchers (e.g., assertNotEquals, hasItems) for writing better unit tests, as well as more useful debugging messages when troubleshooting unit test failures.  Also, unit tests which check that certain calls are being made will require more precise expectations for what will be passed in, which will help detect breaking changes during major refactoring efforts in the future
title: Allow JDK 8 build of CONNECT

description:
I have a question on connection keep alive setting on http headers.  I am not sure if CONNECT is including connection=[Keep-Alive] when sending the request out to our partners.  We are encountering socket timeout when connection is idle for more than 2 minutes (proxy timeout settings).  This is severely impacting one of our partners.  Our proxy team suggested that we include the Keep-Alive ping in the headers to not trigger proxy timeouts.

Below are two example of PD header.  First one is an internal call which has the connection=[Keep-Alive] header.  The second one is the PD request going out to a partner and does not seem to have any http headers besides accepting all media.  This is true for QD, RD service as well.

Is there a setting on CONNECT to include Keep-Alive header?  We are running CONNECT 4.5.1 RC1 on WebSphere.

ID: 52900
Address: http://localhost:9080/Gateway/PatientDiscovery/1_0/EntityPatientDiscovery?wsdl
Encoding: UTF-8
Http-Method: POST
Content-Type: application/soap+xml; charset=UTF-8
Headers: {Accept=[application/soap+xml,multipart/related,text/*], Cache-Control=[no-cache], connection=[Keep-Alive], Content-Length=[15550], content-type=[application/soap+xml; charset=UTF-8], Date=[Wed, 21 Sep 2016 14:52:27 GMT], Host=[localhost:9080], Pragma=[no-cache], User-Agent=[IBM WebServices/1.0]}

 
ID: 76874
Address: https://ehie-en-uat.kp.org/eHIEPatientDiscovery2011
Encoding: UTF-8
Http-Method: POST
Content-Type: application/soap+xml; charset=UTF-8
Headers: {Accept=[*/*]}

Thank You,
Shuvo
title: CONNECT:  Connection Keep Alive

description:
The test fails with NPE(Null Pointer Exception) in responding gateway log.  To see the results, set up the following scenarios (all services are in passthrough):
* Fail: initiator gateway: audit on, response (SavePayloadToFileInbound=true, audit on)
* Work: initiator: audit on, response (SavePayloadToFileInbound=false, audit (either on/off))
* Work: initiator: audit off; response(SavePayloadToFileInbound=true, audit on)

*Reason*: Before X12 prepares to go to NHIN layer, the audit feature (X12BatchAuditTransforms# marshallToByteArrayFromRequest) reset <payload>element to null. This causes the nhin layer doesn’t have <payload>element in the request. When the response gateway receives the request, the service parses the request and expect the <payload> element when the true SavePayloadToFileInbound flag exists in gateway.properties. Since it is not there, it throws NPE (Null pointer exception).  Below is sample audit log from initiator gateway:

{code:java}

    </ActiveParticipant>
    <ActiveParticipant UserID="https://gfe-onc-wdev15.connect.org:8181/Gateway/CORE_X12DocumentSubmission/1_0/GenericBatchRequestTransaction_Service" UserIsRequestor="false" NetworkAccessPointID="gfe-onc-wdev15.connect.org" NetworkAccessPointTypeCode="1">
        <RoleIDCode code="110152" displayName="Destination" codeSystemName="DCM"/>
    </ActiveParticipant>
    <AuditSourceIdentification AuditEnterpriseSiteID="DoD" AuditSourceID="urn:oid:1.1"/>
    <ParticipantObjectIdentification ParticipantObjectID="f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6" ParticipantObjectTypeCode="2" ParticipantObjectTypeCodeRole="20">
        <ParticipantObjectIDTypeCode code="f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6" displayName="Payload Identifier" codeSystemName="CAQH CORE Connectivity Metadata"/>
        <ParticipantObjectDetail value=""/>

</AuditMessage>
{code}


{panel:title=Decode ParticipantObjectDetail }

description:
The CONNECT team has received the following email from Adam Rabinowitz at ManTech:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hello Connect Team,

We’ve discovered a new issue with the CONNECT 4.5.1 product running on JBOSS 6.4.8 on a Red Hat 6.4.x OS. My access to your JIRA system is still not working so I will need your help creating the JIRA ticket for this issue. We need your help on this issue ASAP because it impacts one of our upcoming releases.

The CONNECT 4.5.1 client is forcing us to enable the below system property in the standalone-full.xml configuration file. When this option is NOT enabled the CONNECT 4.5.1 client cannot connect to the TEST UDDI to download a uddiConnectionInfo.xml file.

    <property name="jdk.tls.client.protocols" value="TLSv1"/>


When we try to use a higher TLS protocol (i.e. TLSv1.1 or TLSv1.2) the CONNECT client is throwing the below error.

Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: SSLHandshakeException invoking https://registry-vs.nhinonline.net/uddi/inquiry: Server chose TLSv1, but that protocol version is not enabled or not supported by the client.

TLSv1 is a much older security protocol and has many known security flaws. This finding indicates the CONNECT 4.5.1 client is not current STIG or FIPS compliant. Please address this issue ASAP.

Thank you,
Adam Rabinowitz

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Completion Criteria:

The scope of this ticket is to research the following:

- Can the UDDI server support TLS v1.1 or v1.2?
- If so, determine the solution and effort required, if any, to allow CONNECT to use a newer version of the TLS protocol
title: CONNECT TLS protocol version for connecting to UDDI server- research

description:
The eHealth Exchange is setting up an operational monitoring system with an overarching goal to provide quality assurance about Participant system availability, performance, content quality and conformance. For the first phase, they are going to focus on capturing metrics on reachability, availability and response time. They are developing a system for conducting tests to capture these metrics and create reports. These reports will be given to the participants, as well as the coordinating committee, in the form of a score card.

A CONNECT instance will be set up and integrated into this testing effort.

Completion Criteria:

- Review attached OP&P 11 document
- Identify and set up a test environment, may require adding firewall exceptions
- Stand up a CONNECT instance on WildFly 8.2.1
- Install eHealth Exchange certificates
- Provide Eric Heflin with HCID and endpoints
- Devise a plan for ensuring the server is running on a daily basis until the system has been tested and reports have been acquired

QA:

- Validation suite passes
- eHealth Exchange validation UDDI can be retrieved/refreshed
title: Test CONNECT to ensure that the OP&P monitoring process will work seamlessly with CONNECT

description:
We are an HIH in the esMD domain and have an existing version of CONNECT (3.2) established and working in production.

We need to upgrade to CONNECT 4.x to support large file sizes and X12 payloads.  

We finally were able to get CONNECT 4.6 stood up and the tests in the ValidationSuite passed.  We then got the certificates installed and modified the configuration to use the NSS cert library. Again, all CONNECT ValidationSuite tests have passed.

We then started on the esMD configuration piece.  

We never have gotten a successful response from the esMD End-To-End soapUI tests for the esMD portion.

We have had a couple of conference calls with esMD development and have made configuration changes according to their direction.   However, now we are getting a "Problem writing SAAJ model to stream" error.  esMD dev team has said that there may be a problem with our CONNECT configuration.  Hence they are directing me to the CONNECT help desk.

I can provide you with the current state of our configuration files if needed or any other information. 

Thank you.
title: Problem writing SAAJ model to stream

<versionCode code="V3PR1"/>
…
…

description:
The following changes were made in ConectCommonTypesLib ...\src\main\resources\schemas\HL7V3\NE2008\multicacheschemas\PRPA_MT201306UV02.xsd that change the types generated by JAXB when the schema is used to generate the Java classes.

BEFORE (CommonTypesLib 4.0.7)
   <xs:complexType name="PRPA_MT201306UV02.MinimumDegreeMatch">
      <xs:sequence>
         <xs:group ref="InfrastructureRootElements"/>
         <xs:element name="value" type="ANY" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/>
         <xs:element name="semanticsText" type="ST" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attributeGroup ref="InfrastructureRootAttributes"/>
      <xs:attribute name="nullFlavor" type="NullFlavor" use="optional"/>
   </xs:complexType>

AFTER (CommonTypesLib 4.2.0)
    <xs:complexType name="PRPA_MT201306UV02.MinimumDegreeMatch">
        <xs:sequence>
            <xs:group ref="InfrastructureRootElements"/>
            <xs:element name="value" type="INT" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/>
            <xs:element name="semanticsText" type="ST_explicit" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/>
        </xs:sequence>
        <xs:attributeGroup ref="InfrastructureRootAttributes"/>
        <xs:attribute name="nullFlavor" type="NullFlavor" use="optional"/>
    </xs:complexType>

This change causes a ClassCastException when a partner (e. g. GA HIN) includes the following in their IN201306UV02 response.

<queryByParameter>
                    <queryId root="2.16.840.1.113883.4.349" extension="43ee30e7-f329-4b35-b222-bdc29e8ae98d"/>
                    <statusCode code="new"/>
                    <responseModalityCode code="R"/>
                    <responsePriorityCode code="I"/>
                    <matchCriterionList>
                        <matchAlgorithm>
                            <typeId/>
                            <value xsi:type="II" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>
                            <semanticsText/>
                        </matchAlgorithm>
                        <matchWeight>
                            <typeId/>
                            <value xsi:type="II" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>
                            <semanticsText/>
                        </matchWeight>
                        <minimumDegreeMatch>
                            <typeId/>
                            <value xsi:type="II" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>
                            <semanticsText/>
                        </minimumDegreeMatch>
                    </matchCriterionList>

Questions:
Did the change come from HL7?  If not, is it compliant with the "golden" schemas provided by HL7?

Disclaimer:
There are other changes to PRPA_MT201306UV02.xsd since CommonTypesLib 4.0.7 that further constrain some of these elements, so there could be more issues waiting in the wings beyond the specific example cited here.
title: 4.5.0 Release - Changes made in ConectCommonTypesLib

description:
HISTORY: 
CONNECT currently uses JDK 1.6 as the development version. Java 6/ JDK 1.6 is out of date, released almost 8 years ago (Release date: 2007-05-07) support is becoming increasingly difficult. Migrating to JDK 1.7 should be a straightforward matter as most the of the federal partners have upgraded their app servers to versions that support Java 7/JDK 1.7 
o SSA – WebSphere 8.5
o CMS – WebSphere 8.5
o VA – WebLogic 12.X
o DoD – WebSphere 8.5
BUSINESS VALUE:
More secure due to vulnerabilities addressed in upgraded version
Significant performance improvements in newer release
Reduction in the cost of feature development not developing for two versions of Java to ensure functionality works and is supported by the less robust capabilities of Java 6/JDK 1.6 as well as Java 7/JDK 1.7
CONSIDERATION/DETAIL: 
• Only new development of features post 4.5 will be developed using Java 7/JDK 1.7
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
•	Validation and regression suite all passes after uprgade on all 4 supported application servers
Completion Criteria:
Add to release notes

description:
HISTORY:
Security and code quality scans are run periodically especially at release time on every CONNECT release and the reports are analyzed by the team. 
The team needs to review the report, respond and address pertinent findings. 
The first step will develop a plan to analyze the information that has been provided - Identify which of these are real production impacting security risks. As well as code quality related issues that we consider important to be fixed.  The second step will be to develop a plan to address the findings that must be addressed and provide rationale for the findings that do not need to be addressed.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
Information will be documented in the wiki for every release.
This user story addresses the findings for 4.6.

BUSINESS VALUE:
Helps community and product team better understand results of the scan.
Help prioritize and plan to address any high priority or critical issues.
Allows adopters to meet their internal organizations reviews and deploy the application.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
CC:
Release 4.6 has all Fortify Critical, High, Mediums addressed and/or no related open issues.
Release 4.6 has all Cat1 issues addressed.
SonarQube Criticals and Blockers are addressed
Reviewed findings with DoD/SCQC team

description:
CONNECT 4.x uses Hibernate 3.2.5 for all database calls/access. VA has decided to divest itself on the use of the technology/standard by the end of 2016. As a result, all projects currently utilizing the technology/standard must plan to eliminate their use of the technology/standard. VA has requested to move beyond dated technology for security reasons.

The current publicly available version of Hibernate is 5.1.0, VA TRM references 5.0.x as Approved with Constraints. 
More information on Hibernate requirements can be found here - . See the “Decision” tab on the following Hibernate TRM page: http://www.va.gov/TRM/ToolPage.asp?tid=13#

Requirements listed in https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CONNECTWIKI/System+Administrative+GUI+enhancements+for+audit+viewer are met

description:
We’ve recently setup a few CONNECT 4.4 Gateways to simulate requests from external partners to the DoD VLER System and we noticed a new requirement that previously did not seem to exist in CONNECT 3.3.1. We have some SOAP UI projects which simulate document query requests from external partners that have a patient correlation. In the CONNECT 3.3.1 Gateways we were able to simply pass the DoD patient id and the CONNECT 3.3.1 Gateway would forward our document query requests without checking anything on its internal Adapter service. 

This does not seem possible in the CONNECT 4.4 systems and it looks like we are forced to have a patient setup in the mpi.xml file and the patient must have a correlation record in the  patientcorrelationdb.correlatedidentifiers table. Furthermore, the value we are forced to provide is the patient id setup in the mpi.xml file instead of the DoD patient identifier. Did something change in CONNECT 4.4 and is there a configuration we can apply to bypass the check against the patientcorrelationdb.correlatedidentifiers table?
title: New Question around setup of CONNECT 4.4 and the integrated Adaptor

There have been no changes made in this environment since initial installation in Sept 2014.

Any recommendation on gateway settings or properties that could help eliminate this issue would be appreciated.

description:
In the NwHIN Patient Discovery response message, the following is being sent:

<controlActProcess classCode="CACT" moodCode="EVN"><code code="PRPA_TE201306UV02" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.1.6"/><authorOrPerformer typeCode="AUT"><assignedDevice classCode="ASSIGNED"><id root="209.251.180.228.0.1"/></assignedDevice></authorOrPerformer><subject typeCode="SUBJ"><registrationEvent classCode="REG" moodCode="EVN"><id nullFlavor="NA"/><statusCode code="active"/><subject1 typeCode="SBJ"><patient classCode="PAT"><id extension="alpha10" root="209.251.180.228.0.1"/><statusCode code="**SD**"/>

Per the Sequoia PD Responder checklist, this bolded value must be set to "active"

NwHIN PD 2.0 does not specify that the value must be "active" but in sample message shows "active" as the statusCode@code value.

Underlying IHE XCPD provides an example but does not state it MUST be set to "active" but the sample record it provides does show a value of "active":

*Table 3.55.4.2.2-1 from 2011 IHE XCPD*

||PRPA_HD201310IHE
Patient Registry Find Candidates Response||This HMD extract defines the message used to return records from
a patient registry in response to a Find Candidates Query.
Derived from Figure 3.55.4.2.2-1 (PRPA_RM201310IHE)||
|statusCode [1..1]
Patient (CS) {CNE:active, fixed value= "active"}|A value specifying the state of this record in a patient registry
(based on the RIM role class state-machine). This record is active. |

COMPLETION CRITERIA:

Return a value of "active" instead of "SD" in /Envelope/Body/PRPA_IN201306UV02/controlActProcess/subject/registrationEvent/subject1/
patient/statusCode/@code

QA:

Run the PD responder smoke test in the DIL and confirm that "active" is set in the response in /Envelope/Body/PRPA_IN201306UV02/control
ActProcess/subject/registrationEvent/subject1/patient/statusCode/@code
title: PD Response Message - RegistrationEvent/Subject1/StatusCode "active"

description:
The DoD/ManTech implementation team believes that In the previous CONNECT 3.3.1 version they were able to send DPD requests to a CONNECT 3.3.1 Gateway without including the format code in the request (i.e urn2:accessConsentPolicy>urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.184.500.123456789</urn2:accessConsentPolicy>) and the CONNECT 3.3.1 Gateway would properly handle the request and find appropriate records in its internal MySQL database that have classcode = 57016-8^^2.16.840.1.113883.6.1 saved. However,  CONNECT 4.4 is requiring the formatCode in the <accessConsnsetPolicy> element sent from the requesting Gateway to the CONNECT 4.4 Gateway (i.e urn2:accessConsentPolicy>urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.184.500.123456789^^ssa</urn2:accessConsentPolicy>). If this is not included from the requesting Gateway it prevents the CONNECT 4.4 Gateway from properly querying its internal MySQL Database to find records that have classcode = 57016-8^^2.16.840.1.113883.6.1 saved. 

Following are their questions 

# Is there a way we can disable the requirement of the above formatCode/Classcode in CONNECT 4.4 so it behaves the way it previously did in CONNECT 3.3.1?
# Can you tell us what versions of the CONNECT software introduced the requirement of the formatCode/Classcode in the deferred patient discovery requests?
# Is the above formatCode/Classcode required in CONNECT 4.5?
# Is the above formatCode/Classcode a requirement in the eHealth Exchange specifications?


See attachment for email exchange and other details
title: CONNECT 4.4 out of the box and Deferred PD testing issue - Event Code List/QD responder adapter issue

description:
Received this information(via email) from a participant via Gonzalo(eHealth Exchange/Sequoia Project) on a NPE they are seen related to the UDDI/internal connection info lookup. Also see forum post link in comments. Need to research the internal connection info NPE that is being referenced and also any spec related questions.
----------------------------------------------------------

I'm using CONNECT 4.4.1, and I hooked up a test environment to the
validation UDDI successfully on Wednesday & Friday (I watched the UDDI
download & update no problem).

However, when I fired off a query to an endpoint in my
*internalConnectionInfo.xml* configuration file (unrelated!) I wound up
getting a very vague NullPointerException and my request never even made it
out of my server (FULL stacktrace clipped for readability).

[#|2015-11-13T14:04:47.383-0800|SEVERE|glassfish3.1.2|gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.patientdiscovery.outbound.StandardOutboundPatientDiscovery|_ThreadID=416;_ThreadName=Thread-2;|Exception
> occurred while getting responses from communities
> java.lang.NullPointerException
> at
> gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.connectmgr.ConnectionManagerCacheHelper.getStates(ConnectionManagerCacheHelper.java:94)
> at
> gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.connectmgr.ConnectionManagerCache.filterByRegion(ConnectionManagerCache.java:551)
> ...
> at
> com.sun.grizzly.http.HttpProtocolChain.execute(HttpProtocolChain.java:79)
> at
> com.sun.grizzly.ProtocolChainContextTask.doCall(ProtocolChainContextTask.java:54)
> at
> com.sun.grizzly.SelectionKeyContextTask.call(SelectionKeyContextTask.java:59)
> at com.sun.grizzly.ContextTask.run(ContextTask.java:71)
> at
> com.sun.grizzly.util.AbstractThreadPool$Worker.doWork(AbstractThreadPool.java:532)
> at
> com.sun.grizzly.util.AbstractThreadPool$Worker.run(AbstractThreadPool.java:513)
> at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
> |#]


After floundering for a while I dragged in a developer to help me debug the
CONNECT code itself to find out what was null.

Line 94 of *ConnectionManagerCacheHelper*, as it turns out, is looking for
an categoryBag node on a given businessEnitity. I've gathered that this is
run against *each* endpoint in uddiConnectionInfo for every outbound query
(and, I presume, internalConnectionInfo too).

If this (required?) field doesn't appear, it attempts to iterate through a
null list and throws an unhandled NPE and fails out at that point (despite
the fact that my endpoint was in internalConnectionInfo!!!).

*TL;DR:* if any businessEntity is *missing this categoryBag* node (which
identifies the state/region represented), it breaks outbound queries from
CONNECT 4.4.1 (and maybe other versions).

The two endpoints that were missing this field were:

uddi:OrionHealthGWVAL01:2.16.840.1.113883.3.89.200.6.3.1.0
> uddi:IODIncorporatedGWVAL01:2.16.840.1.113883.3.914


I was able to work around this by deleting the entire businessEntity in the
UDDI (and disabling refresh). (Although I suspect adding a generic one
would have worked as well:)

<businessEntity>

....

<categoryBag>
> <keyedReference keyName="United States" keyValue="US"
> tModelKey="uddi:uddi.org:ubr:categorization:iso3166"/>
> </categoryBag>

</businessEntity>


Glancing at the surrounding code, it looks like this probably was an
oversight in CONNECT itself not to include NPE handling (no idea if newer
versions addressed this), but I wanted to reach out and see if these
entries could be corrected to help others avoid this....
title: Analyze NPE issue during UDDI/internal connection info lookup reported by eHealth Exchange participant

We no longer have access to the same endpoints is there a way to set those up through configuration files on the server? If so which file is it? We are more concerned with the NHINC proxy for PDDQ and DR.

description:
Spoke with Jason Smith last week and worked through a couple issues setting up our Connect server. I went onto the box and made sure the following was uncommented in the gateway.properties.

{{patientDiscovery.inboundPatientDiscovery=gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.patientdiscovery.inbound.PassthroughInboundPatientDiscovery
patientDiscovery.outboundPatientDiscovery=gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.patientdiscovery.outbound.PassthroughOutboundPatientDiscovery}}

After making the changes we are still getting "Patient not found" when running an inbound outbound test. I am currently seeing the following error in the logs. If you need any other information just let me know.

12:32:13,530 DEBUG [gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.transform.audit.PatientDiscoveryTransforms] (http-/0.0.0.0:8181-1) could not obtain HCID from Receiver RepresentedOrganization.: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
title: Could not obtain HCID from Receiver RepresentedOrganization

description:
We installed CONNECT 4.4 onto our local Linux servers. Currently we are running CONNECT on a RHEL 6.5 virtual machine with Java 1.7 and JBOSS 6. We already set up the mysql database and added the appropriate tables. All of the proper ports have been opened and new keystore.jks and cacert.jks files were ccreated. We added all of the certs/passwords/aliases to the saml.properties, signature.properties and trustore.properties. Then we proceeded to configure the standalone-full.xml with ssl configurations. In the instructions it says to add the JAVA_OPTS entries into the standalone.conf but we added system properties to the standalone-full.xml and plugged in the certificate values.

We then started up JBOSS to make sure there were no errors and signed onto the jboss admin console. From there we added all of the datasources and i verified they were all added to the standalone-full.xml. Please take a look at the server.log and email attached to see the errors we are running into. If you need any other information please let me know. Thanks

title: An unexpected exception occurred of type:javax.xml.ws.soap.SOAPFaultException. Exception: Problem writing SAAJ model tostream

description:
DOD team reported issues deploying CONNECT 4.5.0 RC1 in JBoss EAP 6.x. Seeing database issues and its failing inbound and outbound request.

CC:
Work with the DOD team and resolve the issues related to 4.5.0 RC1
title: DOD team reported issues deploying CONNECT 4.5.0 RC1

description:
The issue is due to how the patient ID slot is extracted from the request.  We only compare on the find document type slot name: "$XDSDocumentEntryPatientId".

We need to add in comparisons for all the other types including get all, find submission sets, and find folders.

The issue can be found in current CONNECT code base for the comparison here:
https://github.com/CONNECT-Solution/CONNECT/blob/CONNECT_integration/Product/Production/Services/DocumentQueryCore/src/main/java/gov/hhs/fha/nhinc/docquery/outbound/StandardOutboundDocQueryHelper.java#L154
title: Document Query Outbound Standard only correlates for FindDocuments type

description:
See CONN-1616 for background information. 

CC:
Fix the issue in JBoss.
Make sure CONNECT works on all the application servers with the new fix
Work with DOD support/implementation team to test the code fix
title: Support the ability to configure FIPS (with store type PKCS11) on JBOSS EAP 6.3

description:
Background: DOD reported problems in configuring FIPS (with store type PKCS11) with CONNECT 4.3.1 on JBOSS EAP 6.3.

The CONNECT EAR deploys successfully when JBOSS is configured with NSS in FIPS mode. Even WSDLs, just as the patient discovery WSDL, pulls up fine.

For inbound, the problem after this occur when the WS4J security provider (org.apache.ws.security.components.crypto.Merlin) throws an exception when it sees org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.file=NONE. Normally when it sees org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.keystore.type=PKCS11, it should just start using PKCS11. Through much trial and error, we found that if we add the following properties, we can get inbound queries working:

signature.properties:org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.keystore.type=PKCS11
signature.properties:org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.keystore.provider=SunPKCS11-nss-fips
signature.properties:org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.file=
truststore.properties:org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.keystore.type=PKCS11
truststore.properties:org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.keystore.provider=SunPKCS11-nss-fips
truststore.properties:org.apache.ws.security.crypto.merlin.file=

This is NOT how it should work, but with the provider line added, and the file set to blank, it picks up the PKCS11 certs.

NEXT, we tried to get outbound working, which uses a different mechanism for certs. We get the same error stating that they file can not be set to "NONE" However, appears that it is picking up the NONE string from the JBOSS Application Server since the signature.properties, et al, no longer contain the word NONE. 

The standard way to properly configure PKCS11, the application server keystore and truststore paths should be set to the string, "NONE". Not knowing this, I tried removing or setting,

-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=NONE"
to
-Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore="

but this breaks JBOSS since it requires the word NONE to be there when using PKCS11.

Please advise how to properly configure this. Ideally, the standard method of switching would be that your code would see the type as PKCS11, ignore keystore/truststore paths, and get the NSS database information via the proper PKCS11 Java API.

CC:
Investigate the issue
title: Problems getting FIPS DB configured with CONNECT 4.3.1 on JBOSS EAP 6.3.

description:
Request flow:
HIH submit requests to *Connect Gateway* (CG) through F5 load balancer, CG make a webservice call to BC servers through F5 load balancer.

 Issue:
We are seeing some errors while making a call to F5 to BC, out of the 50 requests at least 6 requests are getting failed with *"could not write attachment"*.
We could see F5 opening 50 connections to CG, 4 JVM's with round robin fashion. CG to F5 to BC also opening 50 connections but out of this dropping in between.

Scenario Tested:
We tested with 50 requests with payload size 10MB with 1 user, 4-6 requests failed. 

WAS Support:
Need WAS support, to troubleshoot the root cause, why connection breaking/reset in middle of processing the request to BC?
title: Could not write attachment issue in Connect Gateway

description:
VA reported the below issue when they try to upgrade their Adapter platform from WebLoigc 12.1.3 from 10.3.5:

After more investigation it has been determined that the header issue is from a third party application.  They are utilizing an older version of CXF for message processing ( https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-1496 ).

We are using JAX-WS to generate the messages to the Gateway.  The version provided in 10.3.5 sends the start-info in separate quoted elements:

start-info="application/soap+xml";action="urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:entitydocretrieve:RespondingGateway_CrossGatewayRetrieveRequestMessage"

The version provided in 12.1.3 quotes out the entire element following XOP specs:
start-info="application/soap+xml;action=\"urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:entitydocretrieve:RespondingGateway_CrossGatewayRetrieveRequestMessage\""

We will be unable to upgrade the version of third party software, and already have a tested and deployable ear that we would like to migrate to 12.1.3.  The question is thus, are there settings that can be changed to use an older version on the app server as opposed to the application?  Or, will this require dependencies and weblogic configurations built into the ear to support this request?

VA CONNECT version: CONNECT 4.2.2.2 
OS: Red Hat Linux/ WebLogic 12c

CC:
Investigate the issue
title: VA Adapter platform upgrade issue from webLogic 10.3.5 to 12.1.3

description:
Background: DoD reported that CONNECT(release 4.3.1) is throwing a Null Pointer exception when the “Conditions” element is missing in the SAML assertion.  The Conditions element is located in AuthzDecisionStatement->Evidence->Assertion in the SAML header. 

Currently CONNECT processes the <Condition> attributes of <NotBefore> and <NotOnOrAfter> and 
assumes they will always be present in the incoming SOAP request if the <AuthzDecisionStatement> is present. 

Per the Authorization Framework (3.0 - section 3.2.3.1 and 3.2.3.2) and underlying SAML spec(http://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/v2.0/saml-core-2.0-os.pdf Section 2.5 and 2.7.4),
the Conditions element within the AuthzDecisionStatement->Evidence->ASsertion is optional and so are the attributes <NotBefore> and <NotOnOrAfter>.

CC:
If Conditions element(within AuthzDecisionStatement->Evidence->ASsertion) or any of its attributes <NotBefore> and <NotOnOrAfter>are not included in the incoming message, null exception should not be thrown by CONNECT. Also make sure we support the following cases:
1. both notBefore and notOnOrAfter present
2. just notBefore present
3. just notOnOrAfter is present
4. both are not present
title: CONNECT throws a null pointer exception when the Authorization Decision Statement in SOAP requests does not include <Conditions> and its attributes <NotBefore>, <NotOnOrAfter>

description:
HISTORY:
Security and code quality scans are run periodically especially at release time on every CONNECT release and the reports are analyzed by the team. The team needs to review the report, respond and address pertinent findings for Release 4.5 . 

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
Information will be documented in the wiki.

BUSINESS VALUE:
Minimizes security risks to the organization by using a secure product.
Assist organizations to meet their internal security reviews as they deploy CONNECT in their preferred environments

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
1)Execute Fortify on Release candidate for 4.5 and identify all issues.
2)Address all Fortify Critical, High, Medium issues.
3) Address all Cat 1 category issues
4) Update mitigation documentation for issues that were not addressed by code change. - Release wiki page needs to be updated with appropriate reason/rationale/references and/or appropriate workarounds or best practices that implementers need to have in place. 
4)Re-Run Fortify and ensure that there are no new issues introduced.
5)Follow-up with DoD security team
title: As a CONNECT implementer, I want to address all security issues identified as part of Fortify scans to be fixed so that the code is secure and compliant with DoD requirements for code quality

description:
Can you answer below questions

1.	Resource ID in the SAML header – is this required to create a correlation with VA?  Is it required for DQ/DR to work with VA?

2.	LivingSubjectID – Can they send more than 1 LivingSubjectID with assigning authority and unique patient ID or can we just deal with a single one per message?

Today they send something like this that just has the SSN:
<livingSubjectId><value root="2.16.840.1.113883.4.1" extension=" ssnxxxxxx "/><semanticsText representation="TXT" mediaType="text/plain"/></livingSubjectId>

Other partners send 2 LivingSubjectIDs and the 2nd one has the assigning authority and unique ID like this:
<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDxx" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.13"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
</ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="ssnxxxxxx" root="2.16.840.1.113883.4.1"/><ns3:semanticsText/></ns3:livingSubjectId>

They are asking what we do if they send this:
<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDx1" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.13"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDx2" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.11"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDx2" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.13"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
</ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="ssnxxxxxx" root="2.16.840.1.113883.4.1"/><ns3:semanticsText/></ns3:livingSubjectId>


As to the multiple ID’s I believe that we only support the SSN and the ID associated with the assigning authority/HCID.  Even if we add support for these items, I think that MVI overwrites what is currently there with the new information, on a facility basis.  This would cause an issue in the case of the two highlighted items.  They both have the same AAID/HCID with two different patient ID’s.

<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDx1" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.13"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDx2" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.11"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
<ns3:livingSubjectId><ns3:value extension="xxuniquepatientIDx2" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.42.10001.100001.13"/><ns3:semanticsText/>
title: SAML header content requirements

description:
Can you please confirm below for Connect gateway 4.2.2 version currently running in our production environment.

1.	The individual operation timeouts for PD and QD in red below in gateway.properties file does not have any effect 
on exchange/adapter service timeouts anymore. 

     # timeout used to set proxy timeouts, in milliseconds.  Maps to:
     # ((BindingProvider) port).getRequestContext().put(KEY_CONNECT_TIMEOUT, timeout);
     # ((BindingProvider) port).getRequestContext().put(KEY_REQUEST_TIMEOUT, timeout);
     # default to 1 min (1m = 60s = 60000ms)
      webserviceproxy.timeout=240000
      webserviceproxy.retryattempts=0
      webserviceproxy.retrydelay=30000
      webserviceproxy.exceptionstext=SocketTimeoutException
     
      # web service client socket read timeout in millis
      # this timeout is the time (in millis) the client will wait for the server to
      # write the http response to the socket
      # NOTE that ServiceName used below must match ServiceName in NhincConstants
      PatientDiscovery.webserviceproxy.request.timeout=120000
      QueryForDocuments.webserviceproxy.request.timeout=120000

2.	The only timeout enforced on all exchange operations including inbound and outbound is webserviceproxy.timeout=240000 (4 minutes)
3.	What is the effect of the property webserviceproxy.retrydelay=30000 on gateway operations ? Also we have set webserviceproxy.retryattempts=0 not to reattempt the same operation.
4.	How can we track timeouts for a particular operation and for a particular partner with Connect 4.2.2 version ?
title: individual operation timeouts for PD and QD

description:
We have various flavors of the hl7 attribute scoping(for SAMLattributes of PurposeOfUse and Role) in the eHealth exchange at this point - some utilize the qualified version and some unqualified. The goal of this ticket is to evaluate/test whether supported releases of CONNECT can accept both forms of these attributes as the responding gateway. This will help determine and assess interoperability impacts in the eHealth Exchange ecosystem.

A qualified version would be 
<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="307969004" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" hl7:codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" hl7:displayName="Public Health" xsi:type="hl7:CE"/> 
<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="PUBLICHEALTH" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" hl7:codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" hl7:displayName="Use or disclosure of Psychotherapy Notes" xsi:type="hl7:CE"/>

An unqualified version would be
 <hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="307969004" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" displayName="Public Health" xsi:type="hl7:CE"/> 
<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="PUBLICHEALTH" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" displayName="Use or disclosure of Psychotherapy Notes" xsi:type="hl7:CE"/>

CC:
* Validate and document CONNECT 4.4.1's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with qualified attributes(prefixed hl7 attributes ie., hl7:code, hl7:codeSystem,hl7:codeSystemName and hl7:displayName)
* Validate and document CONNECT 4.4.1's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with unqualified attributes( non-prefixed hl7 attributes ie., code, codeSystem, codeSystemName and displayName)

* Validate and document CONNECT 4.3.2's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with qualified attributes(prefixed hl7 attributes ie., hl7:code, hl7:codeSystem,hl7:codeSystemName and hl7:displayName)
* Validate and document CONNECT 4.3.2's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with unqualified attributes( non-prefixed hl7 attributes ie., code, codeSystem, codeSystemName and displayName)

* Validate and document CONNECT 4.2.2.2's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with qualified attributes(prefixed hl7 attributes ie., hl7:code, hl7:codeSystem,hl7:codeSystemName and hl7:displayName)
* Validate and document CONNECT 4.2.2.2's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with unqualified attributes( non-prefixed hl7 attributes ie., code, codeSystem, codeSystemName and displayName)

* Validate and document CONNECT 3.3.1.3's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with qualified attributes(prefixed hl7 attributes ie., hl7:code, hl7:codeSystem,hl7:codeSystemName and hl7:displayName)
* Validate and document CONNECT 3.3.1.3's behavior as the responding gateway when receiving inbound message with unqualified attributes( non-prefixed hl7 attributes ie., code, codeSystem, codeSystemName and displayName)
title: Validate whether supported versions of CONNECT are able to accept both qualified and unqualified attributes for code,codesystem,displayName for SAML Role and PurposeOfUse attributes

description:
Phased approach - 
Creating a POC for JBoss to be utilized at the HIMSS demo. The other application servers will be looked at later.

Business Value:
Simple test tool to validate PD, QD and RD functions.
Ease of use utilizing a simplified GUI with a consistent GUI look and feel

CC:
Universal Client calls to demonstrate Patient Discovery, Query for Documents and Retrieve Documents are included in the System Administration module
Complete documentation (testing cases) and manual updates
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want the legacy universal client to be included in the Admin GUI and enhanced with the new look and feel so that it is easier to use and consistent with the CONNECT GUI look and feel

description:
This would need a POC first to handle properties view and update via Admin GUI
Research required on what properties are in scope - Discussed that gateway.properties are in scope. This would involve analysis, cleanup of the property files and then investigating which of these can be updated via Admin GUI.
This will be extended to support/include other properties files

Business value:
Simplify gateway management by making it easy to use and update configuration files

CC: 
Gateway properties file can be viewed and updated through the Admin GUI
CONNECT functionality should be tested on all supported application servers
Admin GUI manual should be updated with new functionality
title: As a CONNECT system administrator, I want to have the ability to view and update gateway configuration files, via a simple GUI interface, so that it is easier for me to manage my gateway instance

description:
MedVirginia recently started seeing errors when attempting to instantiate a Document Retrieve request against the Veteran's Affairs endpoint on the eHealth Exchange.  In the CONNECT logs, they see something like the following with a corresponding stack trace:

2015-03-06T16:50:00.917-0500
javax.xml.ws.WebServiceException: Could not send Message.
Caused by: java.net.SocketException: SocketException invoking <hostname>/Gateway/DocumentRetrieve/3_0/NhinService/RespondingGateway_Retrieve_Service/DocRetrieve: Unexpected end of file from server
Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Unexpected end of file from server

MedVirginia also ran a WireShark session to watch the transaction at a packet level and  they were able to notice the DR transaction never left the CONNECT gateway. They can see the DR Entity Request come in and the transaction is logged as beginning the outbound process, then they got the above message in the log within the fraction of a second.

MedVirgina also mentioned that they are seeing 50% success rate and 50% of the transactions were failing with the about error.
title: Document Retrieve issues between MedVirginia and VA

description:
Client is seeing these after installing CONNECT 4.4.1
000000b0 SystemOut     O 2015-02-18 21:06:45 ERROR AdapterEndpointManager:87 - Error getting API Level by Service Name:
 
000000b0 SystemOut     O 2015-02-18 21:06:45 ERROR AdapterEndpointManager:69 - Error getting highest API Level:

After conducting research, we believe the issue is boiled down to null values in the EventTime column of the Event Table. We updated the column to the current date/time and got it working.

Further, we uninstalled 4.4.1 and installed CONNECT 4.3 and the EventTime column populates fine.  4.4.1 seems to always be inserting a null value for EventTime.

Appreciate your investigation and advice on how to address.
title: CONNECT 4.4.1 Websphere throwing exceptions when Oracle Database is utilized

description:
Connect 4.2.2 is sending PD request with timestamp after signature block in the header section. All the partners are working without any issue except SCHIEX partner. 
SCHIEX partner uses Microsoft product  and requesting us to move the time stamp on to the top in the header section. 

I have couple question regarding above issue:

Is timestamp possible to move up for SCHIEX partner ? 
If we make that change, would impact other partners ? if yes, what are other options that we have ?

let me know your recommendation regarding this issue.
title: Connect 4.2.2 is sending PD request with timestamp after signature block in the header section

We are looking into did the HIH really send 4 files etc
However our question is could CONNECT be dropping PDF files for any reason?

description:
CC:
4.4.1 released to the community with supporting binary artifacts
title: As a CONNECT product manager, I would like to release 4.4.1 to the community, to provide a release that addresses all known issues discovered during eHealth Exchange participant certification

description:
HISTORY: In Release 4.4 CONNECT implemented the NwHIN CAQH Core X12 Document Submission specifications enabling CMS and other providers the ability to exchange X12 payloads using both Real Time and Generic Batch transactions. It was discussed that this feature would be developed in iterations or phases. The next phase will include auditing these transactions at the gateway.

BUSINESS VALUE:
•	Specification compliance
•	Information availability for audit inquiries

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL: 
Detail and requirements are gathered here - https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/x/I4DZAQ

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
•	Functional and non-functional requirements as defined in https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/x/I4DZAQ are met.
•	Testing completed successfully on all supported application servers
•	Documentation requirements are met.
title: As an adopter using CAQH CORE X12 DS service, I want all X12 service transactions inbound and outbound to be audited, so that the gateway is compliant with the specifications and I have the needed information if needed to support any audit inquiry

description:
When the MatchCriterionList.MinimumDegreeMatch element value is set in the PD request, CONNECT throws the below exception com.sun.istack.SAXParseException2; Unable to create an instance of org.hl7.v3.ANY

Need to fix the schema for hl7:value element under hl7:minimumDegreematch element.

Right now in codebase it is showing as :
<xs:element name="value" type="ANY" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/>

CC:
Change the PRPA_MT201306UV02.MinimumDegreeMatch value elmement from ANY to hl7 INT type.
<xs:element name="value" type="INT" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/>
title: Fix the MatchCriterionList MinimumDegreeMatch value datatype to hl7 INT type from hl7 ANY type in the PD Request

title: As a CONNECT implementer, I want to ensure that there are no High, Critical and Cat 1 issues so that CONNECT continues to be secure.

description:
CC: 
 - Able to display remote connections in the Admin GUI.
 - Able to select a remote endpoint and send a ping test to verify connectivity.
 - Update Admin GUI manual to include feature

QA should include testing between two remote gateways over secured ssl to verify connectivity (both positive and negative test cases).

Scope limited to only remote endpoints, does not included the internal connection endpoints and the local gateway's external nhin endpoints (so just the endpoints of partner gateways).
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I would like an interface in the System Administration module for pinging remote partners so that I may trouble shoot connectivity.

description:
From Pull Request submitted on github by Teruyuki Morimura:

"Changes in this request fix an issue that CXF SOAP client cannot pick up a private key specified by CLIENT_KEY_ALIAS variable if there are more than two private keys in the keystore file.
SSLSocketFactory is used in org.apache.cxf.transport.https.HttpsURLConnectionFactory anyway."

CC: Review code and analyze and confirm fix intent.  Further, need to test for any impacts on interoperability.

--Need context to why this change was necessary for the contributor.
title: Community Contribution - Allow for multiple private keys

description:
Background - 
It is understood at this point(after release 4.4) that there are some issues with CONNECT audit messages in that certain ATNA audit fields are not correctly logged. Some of these were discovered as part of tickets (CONN-56,CONN-57,CONN-58, CONN-59). The goal of this ticket is validate CONNECT audit messages against the Healtheway manual checklists for auditing(for PD, QD, and RD) and identify the deltas or issues that need to be fixed.

Healtheway test documentation can be found here - 
Healtheway Participant testing page - http://healthewayinc.org/index.php/exchange/participant-testing/12-testing/89-testing-case-documentation-and-test-data
Checklist -  http://healthewayinc.org/images/Content/Documents/Testing-Documents/applicant-conformance-checklists-nov18.zip

Use CONNECT 4.4 codebase and manually review the audit message output against the checklists. This information needs to be documented in the wiki.

Here is some previous analysis on the specifications that was done during the Audit redesign that will be useful - https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/8585621/CONNECT_audit_wiki.xlsx?version=1&modificationDate=1377191915000&api=v2


CC:
Review CONNECT generated audit messages against PD initiator and responder manual checklists from HealtheWay
Review CONNECT generated  audit messages against QD initiator and responder manual checklists from HealtheWay
Review CONNECT generated  audit messages against RD initiator and responder manual checklists from HealtheWay
Document issues found on the wiki (external)
Compare issues against tickets in the backlog(CONN-56,CONN-57,CONN-58, CONN-59) to identify all deltas to be fixed inorder to be eHealth Exchange spec compliant.
title: As a CONNECT implementer, I want HealtheWay audit checklists to be reviewed with the CONNECT codebase to identify all audit spec compliance issues

description:
Need messages to be captured for the following CONNECT versions so that these can be referenced later. This includes inbound and outbound messages for the Exchange services and X12 if applicable(X12 applicable for 4.4).

Capture the Outbound and Inbound Messages (Request and Response) for 3 interfaces as defined in ticket for g1 suite of ValidationSuite.

- Release 4.4
- Release 4.3.2
- Release 4.2.2.2
- Release 3.3.1.3

These should be done for all services
- DS (Synchronous and Deferred)
- AD
- RD
- PD (Deferred and Synchronous)
- QD
- X12 DS (Generic and Batch)

For all interfaces (INBOUND AND OUTBOUND)
NHIN
Entity
Adapter

Use this directory structure and naming convention:  \\192.168.35.9\ConnectShare\CONNECTMessage\4.2.2

As an example for 4.4 Gateway initiating request
1. Entity Outbound (Request)
2. Nhin Outbound (Request)
3. Entity Inbound (Response)

Responding Gateway : For a DocumentSubmission there may be AdapterComponentXDR Request and Responses in additional to the above. If there is additional Adapter Requests and Responses capture those also in the sharedrive for any service.

As an example for 4.4 Gateway responding to external remote requests
1. Nhin Inbound (Request)
2. Adapter Outbound (Request)
3. Adapter Inbound (Response)
4. Nhin Outbound (Response)

CC 
Messages are stored in the shared drive

QA:
review the shared drive.
Validate that all the 7 messages for all the services are saved.
Verify that the message is correct for the service/interface and direction(inbound/outbound)

NOTE: There may not be 7 messages for all services. Requests generally do not make adapter calls, responses generally do not make entity calls.
title: Generate and save CONNECT messages for supported releases for future reference

description:
Currently, the Direct README.md is a large document covering everything needed for understanding and setting up CONNECT Direct.  This file is difficult to properly maintain as it requires a pull request for every update.

The Direct README.md should be a brief introduction that provides links to more detailed documentation, while the current content should be moved to the CONNECT wiki.  If possible, information that is likely change any given release (version numbers, build process details, etc) should be left out.

CC:

README.md contains the bare minimum information about Direct.  Links are provided for in-depth information.

QA:

Peer review of README.md and wiki documentation.
title: Simplify Direct README.md

description:
The fix to CONN-1310 was only applied to the ParameterList in QueryByParameter and was not applied to the MatchCriterionList elements in the PD request schema ie.,. in the 
1)MatchAlgorithm
2)MinimumDegreeMatch

Spec reference : http://www.ihe.net/Technical_Framework/upload/IHE_ITI_Suppl_XCPD_Rev2-1_TI_2010-08_10.pdf
See page 29
Spec factory forum post : http://exchange-specifications.wikispaces.com/share/view/68996574

CC:
Validate against manual checklist from Healtheway
If semanticsText value e.g
a) <semanticsText>MatchAlgorithm</semanticsText>
b) <semanticsText>MinimumDegreeMatch</semanticsText>
 is populated in the entity request, that value should be sent to the NwHIN in the PD request
title: CONNECT is removing SemanticsText value for MatchCriterionList elements - MatchAlgorithm and MinimumDegreeMatch

title: Build: Split CONNECTCoreLib

description:
Currently, each gateway project includes its reference adapter counterpart, despite the fact that these adapters are not supported for use in Production.  We need a way to build a gateway-only deployment, which does not include the reference adapters.

CC:

Should be discussed when planning this ticket.  Things to consider:

- Should there be two EARs (Gateway EAR, Adapter EAR), or should there be one EAR that is build as either "just gateway" or "gateway and adapters"?
- Should this be handled by profile (e.g., -P PD,DQ,adapters) or by property (e.g., -DincludeAdapters=true)?

QA:

TBD based on CC
title: Build: Create Gateway-only deployment

description:
Currently, our default build artifacts contain far more than is needed (or wanted) for a standard Production deployment.

Just a couple examples:
- Each gateway project includes its reference adapter counterpart, despite the fact that these adapters are not supported for use in Production.
- CONNECTCoreLib contains not just shared CONNECT functionality, but also Gateway project-specific code that really should be split into their own projects.

description:
Background - See CONN-654 where this issue was discovered. 

To summarize the issue, CONNECT has a NIST reported error when sending a Document submission message from CONNECT system to the NIST testing tool.
ERROR: role(gov.nist.hit.ds.wsseTool.validation.tests.run.AttributeStatementVal) : wrong codeSystem expected:<[2.16.840.1.113883.6.96]> but was:<[]>  &&&& gov.nist.hit.ds.wsseTool.validation.WsseHeaderValidator
ERROR: purposeOfUse(gov.nist.hit.ds.wsseTool.validation.tests.run.Attribut eStatementVal) : wrong codeSystem expected:<[2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1]> but  was:<[]> &&&& gov.nist.hit.ds.wsseTool.validation.WsseHeaderValidator 

The error as reported by the NIST team stems from the fact that the Role and PurposeOfUse elements have their attributes code, codeSystem, codeSystemName and displayName explicitly scoped to hl7 which is not acceptable by hl7 RIM schema validators used in validation.  

Our current representation  of the attribute in CONNECT is - 
<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="106328005" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" hl7:codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" hl7:displayName="Social worker" xsi:type="hl7:CE" />

This implementation as above was fixed in CONN-1273  based on recommendation from the partner(SSA) to ensure that the attributes were correctly scoped.

The highlighted(hl7:codeSystem, hl7:codeSystemName, hl7:displayName, hl7:code) is what the NIST validators are complaining about. Adding the hl7 namespace at the attribute level is breaking the HL7 V3 schemas(CDA). 

CONNECT has a requirement to make sure that CONNECT also successfully passes NIST test cases. However, the team has not seen any issues with this representation in the DIL/Healtheway/eHealth Exchange testing. 

The team is not particularly not clear about how the above representation is not legal from an XML perspective, or whether using the CDA schema for validation is appropriate in here and would need further discussion both with SSA and NIST teams and maybe at some point also with the spec factory.

CC:
Follow-up with the concerning parties (SSA, NIST and Spec factory)
title: Research and follow-up on the PurposeOfUse and Role scoping issue discovered as part of NIST DS testing

description:
Background : VA requires that this be fixed in their 4.2.2.2 environment as they failed manual checklist items as reviewed by Healtheway. 

The issue is related to the mustUnderstand element in the WSA Action element in the synchronous response which is not being set in the QD synchronous response -

1.	The failure is for the QD Responder Response message (QDR) in the 2011 Smoke Tests.  The checklist error is
1.	FAIL: Checklist CL QD Responder Response #3501
	"Verify:"S:Envelope/S:Header/wsa:Action
	WHERE
	@role is omitted
	OR
	@role = ""http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/ultimateReceiver””"
	wsa:Action MUST be urn:ihe:iti:2007:CrossGatewayQueryResponse.
	- @mustUnderstand is present and = ""true"" OR ”1”
	- There may be other instances of this element with different @role values, but this checklist does not address them.
	Description: wsa:Action is the URI indicating specific action that is requested to be performed by the service”
2.	The item highlighted “@mustUnderstand is present and = “true” OR “1” is missing in QD Responder Response message leveraging CONNECT 4.2.2.2

Note - While it seems that this issue was found on the QD responder test case it does impact all services and not just QD. 

Currently CONNECT populates attribute ‘mustUnderstand’ value = ‘True’ for ‘action’ and ‘ReplyTo’ elements in the SOAP header in an initiating request, deferred request and a deferred response, but does not set it in the Synchronous response header for all services and the deferred acknowledgements in response to Deferred requests and responses. 
CONNECT accepts both values 1/0 or True/False as the responding side.

CC:
Services PD, QD, RD, DS, AD synchronous responses need to have the wsa:Action attribute @mustUnderstand to be present and with a value of -  ""true"" OR ”1”
Deferred services for DS and PD, need to have the wsa:Action attribute @mustUnderstand to be present and with a value of -  ""true"" OR ”1” in the acknowledgement messages in response to the Deferred request and Deferred response.
title: Set "mustUnderstand" attribute on the WS-Addressing  Action element in the SOAP response message

description:
Due to differences in the random data used for SecureRandom, the fix for CONN-1394 worked in Windows but failed when tested on Unix.  This is because the generated Salt on Unix is using characters that cause parsing issues.

Also, when diagnosing the issue, it became difficult to tell if the right password had been entered, or if there were parsing issues, due to the lack of a password confirmation field.

When creating a new user, we need a password confirmation field, and we also need that password to be saved with a human-readable salt value.

CC:

Password is confirmed before it is saved.
Salt value uses Base 64 characters.

QA:

1. Cannot create new (unique) user when password and password confirmation fields do not match.
2. Can create new (unique) user when password and password confirmation fields match.
3. Salt value for a newly-created user consists solely of the following values: [A-Z], [a-z], [0-9], +, /, =
title: CONNECTAdminGUI - Password Issues

description:
This request came in from VA that are currently using Release 4.2.2.2 in  production.
Some of the over arching questions they have related to performance tuning - 
- How to gain efficiencies.
- How to synchronize timeouts between layers in the architecture to avoid problems?

Some specific questions related to their environment-

Retry  functionality on PD request : In production, a partner was unresponsive last two days, but yesterday was started working. Our gateway sent 16 PD requests to the partner which were not sent by adapter. This was happened same minute - What could be the cause??
 If any of the partner is unresponsive, what happens in the connect application ? Does it respond back to adapter in outbound scenario ( we are seeing stuck thread issue on adapter application whenever partner was unresponsive).
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want a "Tuning guide" or "Performance Tip Sheet" to help anticipate, understand and avoid performance issues where possible

title: Research the code to understand how to set the Action->mustUnderstand attribute for Real Time/synchronous response for NwHN CAQH CORE X12 DS service without impacting any other SOAP services

description:
Email from Srinivasarao Eadaro 10/25/2014 -

While sending request, we are sending mustUnderstand=true in Action and replyTo tags however we are not seeing mustUnderstand=true in the synchronous response coming from gateway.

Please see request and response Action tags and also attached request and response messages.

This is high priority, Can you please help me fixing this ?
 
Request:
<Action soap:mustUnderstand="true" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">RealTimeTransaction</Action>
 
Response:
<Action xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">http://www.caqh.org/SOAP/WSDL/CORETransactions/RealTimeTransactionResponse</Action>
title: Fix mustUnderstand in synchronous Real Time Response action for CAQH/X12 service

description:
Once Payer has identified the request as a 278, Payer will have a fixed amount of time to process the request—20 seconds for real-time transactions. Otherwise, the request times out.

We need to test to see how much time does it take at the gateway to process the message out(for 20MB since that is the max that can be expected for real time) and make sure that the gateway does not introduce any bottlenecks preventing the response to be sent in that time.

CC:
Utilize 20 MB payload for a real time response and measure time taken at the gateway for processing and sending response w payload  to the requester.
Testing to be done in WAS 8.5/Solaris.
Document gateway's performance with regards to gateway processing time.
Identify other parameters that may impact the processing time at the gateway e.g. network bandwidth.
title: Test whether CONNECT is able to process Real time payload of 20MB within <20 seconds at the gateway

description:
Link to Analysis wiki page for error handling: https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CONNECTWIKI/Error+Handling

2 exception handling test cases that we need to investigate for X12 DS

1) A SOAP request with HTTP headers properly formatted but using the wrong SOAP version (1.1 instead of 1.2)
This will get HTTP Status 500, and a SOAP fault with a fault code “VersionMismatch.”  And text “"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope", the namespace on the "Envelope" element, is not a valid SOAP version.”

2) Any other SOAP envelope errors- The envelope sent by the sender did not conform to the expected format.
A compliant SOAP fault (see section SOAP Faults below) will be generated with the code as “Sender” fault code and text “SOAP exception detail..................”

The goal of this ticket is to leverage existing DIL test cases and environment to identify what test cases are available for SOAP envelope validation and how CONNECT handles faults using CXF.

CC:
Identify existing DIL test cases if any that fall within this category
Determine if there is any contention or differences between the current SOAP services implementation and the X12 services requirements wrt. faults
Clearly understand when CONNECT throws SOAP fault and where in CXF code and how such exceptions are handled
title: Research DIL test cases to validate how CONNECT responds to SOAP envelope issues

description:
Description:
Follow the design document and update the source code to handle exceptions in Core X12 Services RealTime, Generic Batch Request, Generic Batch Response.
Link to Analysis/design: https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CONNECTWIKI/Error+Handling 

Implement the following exception  handling scenarios

1) Adapter is not reachable
A compliant Error response will be generated in this case. with  “Receiver” ErrorCode and ErrorMessage “Failed to connect to backend adapter to process the message”

2) Target community is not specified in the entity request for Real Time Request, Deferred Request and Deferred Response
(see Envelope Processing Errors section below)
Error response 
PayloadType = CoreEnvelopeError
ProcessingMode= Real Time or Batch
PayloadID= <would this be the payload ID of the request?> -- Yes
Timestamp = Message Creation Time
SenderID = SenderID from the request message
ReceiverID = ReceiverID from the request message
CORERuleVersion= 2.2.0
Payload = <send the same payload back from the request>
ErrorCode = Sender
ErrorMessage = "NwHIN target communities not specified in entity request”

CC:
After completing this user story we should be getting the proper error messages back as part of the response messages.
Run soapUI test by running some failure scenarios and ensure proper exceptions were returned.
Update design document to ensure the scenarios/error handlng is captured.

QA:
Entity Exception:
Use SoapUI Validation Test and comment out NhinTargetCommunities block for X12 Realtime, Generic Batch Request, Generic Batch Response messages. You should see the error response coming back from Entity Layer.

Adapter Exception:
Use SoapUI Validation Test and run X12 RealTIme, X12 Generic Batch Request, X12 Generic Batch Response test cases after commenting out the Adapter endpoints in internalConnectionInfo.xml file.
Open ICI file and comment out BusinessServices listed below:
- adaptercore_x12dsrealtimesecured
- adaptercore_x12dsrealtime
- adaptercore_x12dsgenericbatchrequestsecured
- adaptercore_x12dsgenericbatchrequest
- adaptercore_x12dsgenericbatchresponsesecured
- adaptercore_x12dsgenericbatchresponse

And run all 3 test cases so that you should see Adapter error response.
title: Implement Exception Handling in X12 Services

description:
HISTORY: 
 The Federal Health Architecture (FHA) is continuing to improve and evolve the CONNECT product as a production-ready implementation of the Nationwide Health Information Network specifications. With the guidance of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid - Office of Financial Management (CMS/OFM),  the CONNECT team is working to further the capabilities of the CONNECT gatewayto broaden the exchange of health information by supporting the NwHIN approved specifications for CAQH Core compliant transactions with ASC X12 submission payload. 
CONNECT already implements the NwHIN specifications for Document Submission service currently used by the CMS esMD gateway which utilizes IHE XDR as the payload. CMS would like to support their HIHs that have X12 capabilities and utilize the related NwHIN approved specifications for CAQH Core compliant transactions with ASC X12 submission payload, thereby expanding their trading partners' base and providing alternative submission mechanisms.

BUSINESS VALUE: 
1)Enable adopters to exchange X12 payloads via CONNECT.
2)Allows CMS to interoperate with trading partners utilizing CAQH Core X12 payloads submission thereby expanding their scope of exchange and supporting more trading partners.
3)Broadening the supported message transports that can be used for healthcare data exchange
.
CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:
Link to the requirements page - https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/x/aYCb

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
- CONNECT Gateway shall have the ability to send Generic Batch Submission(Deferred) NwHIN CAQH CORE X12 Document Submission transactions with X12 payload.
- CONNECT Gateway shall have the ability to receive Generic Batch Submission(Deferred) NwHIN CAQH CORE X12 Document Submission transactions with X12 payload.
- CONNECT Gateway shall support error reporting for exceptions generated at the gateway via SOAP faults and log any errors at the gateway in the server logs.
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want the ability to send  Generic Batch(Deferred)NwHIN CAQH CORE X12 Document Submission transactions with X12 payload.

description:
CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:
One of the CONNECT users having issues with semanticsText elements in Patient Discovery, basically the values passed in the PD entity request are getting removed by CONNECT and because of this they are flagged/failed during the Healtheway Product certification.

For example:
Expected: <semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.addr</semanticsText>
Found: <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>

See forum post for background information -
http://forums.connectopensource.org/CONNECT-is-removing-SemanticsText-s-value-td7579629.html

Based on our research we confirmed that it’s an issue with CONNECT, basically the generated HL7 ST data type JAXB class used in the semanitcsText element is not supporting the mixed mode value. Based on our further analysis, we figured out using HL7 ST_explicit data type resolves the issue.

The following are the fields impacted by this issue (under controlActProcess:queryByParameter:parameterList):
1.	LivingSubjectId
2.	LivingSubjectName
3.	LivingSubjectBirthTime
4.	LivingSubjectAdministrativeGender
5.	PatientAddress
6.	PaitentTelecom
7.	LivingSubjectBirthPlaceAddress
8.	LivingSubjectBirthPlaceName
9.	MothersMaidenName
10.	PrincipalCareProviderId

CC:
1. Change the data type used in all the aboove elements from ST to ST_explicit in common types module. Generate the new common types module and upload it to the maven repo.
2. Fix the CONNECT code to use ST_explicit data type instead of ST and also update the common types module version used
3. Make sure regression nightly passes and ValidationSuite passes in both standard and passthrough
QA:
Run PD ValidationSuite test (both Standard & Passthrough) and check the entity, adapter and nhin message to make sure the semantics text value is passed properly.
title: CONNECT is removing SemanticsText's value from the edge/entity in PD request to NwHIN

description:
See forum post for background information -

CC:

title: Research : CONNECT is removing SemanticsText's value from the edge/entity in PD request to NwHIN
