description:
Several vendors (Orion, Epic, etc.) as well as some participant testers (DoD) have been receiving errors when testing based on Healtheway manual checklists.  These errors haven't been identified in previous participant testing but are showing up with more frequency since product testing has been opened up to the community.  

This ticket is to track work that has come to the product Team's attention through forums, email requests or Healtheway.  Most of these issues identified to this point are around namespaces and messages semantics.  

The are several currents questions:
- (PD, QD, RD)
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema
 
- (PD)
http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/
http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-secureconversation/200512

- (PD)
Expected but did not find any text in node
 
/Envelope/Header/ReplyTo/@mustUnderstand
 
FOUND:
 
<Action xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">urn:ihe:iti:2007:CrossGatewayQuery</Action>

- (Semantics)
For example: 
Expected: <semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.addr</semanticsText>
Found: <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>

This is a snippet of our request to CONNECT: 
<ns2:parameterList nullFlavor="">
        <ns2:livingSubjectAdministrativeGender nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value code="M" nullFlavor=""/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.administrativeGender</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectAdministrativeGender>
        <ns2:livingSubjectBirthTime nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" value="20080531"/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.birthTime</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectBirthTime>
        <ns2:livingSubjectId nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value extension="84568-4562" nullFlavor="" root="251.251.251"/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.id</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectId>
        <ns2:livingSubjectName nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <ns2:given partType="GIV" qualifier="">Scott</ns2:given>
                        <ns2:family partType="FAM" qualifier="">Daniel</ns2:family>
                </ns2:value>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.name</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectName>
        <ns2:patientAddress nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <ns2:streetAddressLine partType="SAL">106 Unicorn Lane</ns2:streetAddressLine>
                        <ns2:streetAddressLine partType="SAL">Rainbow</ns2:streetAddressLine>
                </ns2:value>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.addr</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:patientAddress>
        <ns2:patientTelecom nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" use="" value="tel:(09) 777-2222"/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.telecom</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:patientTelecom>
</ns2:parameterList>

This is a snippet of our request from CONNECT to the external gateway: 
<parameterList nullFlavor="">
        <livingSubjectAdministrativeGender nullFlavor="">
                <value code="M" nullFlavor=""/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectAdministrativeGender>
        <livingSubjectBirthTime nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" value="20080531"/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectBirthTime>
        <livingSubjectId nullFlavor="">
                <value extension="84568-4562" nullFlavor="" root="251.251.251"/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectId>
        <livingSubjectName nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <given partType="GIV" qualifier="">Scott</given>
                        <family partType="FAM" qualifier="">Daniel</family>
                </value>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectName>
        <patientAddress nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <streetAddressLine partType="SAL">106 Unicorn Lane</streetAddressLine>
                        <streetAddressLine partType="SAL">Rainbow</streetAddressLine>
                </value>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </patientAddress>
        <patientTelecom nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" use="" value="tel:(09) 777-2222"/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </patientTelecom>
</parameterList>

CC: 
- Research issues and support meetings with Healtheway/ Vendor
- Create any tickets needed for required modifications to CONNECT
title: Support and Research Heatheway Product Certifications Issues

description:
The changes related to CONN-875 were not complete, and have introduced a bug.  CONNECT 4.3 is emitting the following for both Role and PurposeOfUse elements in SAML assertion.

<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="106328005" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" displayName="Social worker" xsi:type="CE" />


<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="COVERAGE" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" displayName="Disclosures for insurance or disability coverage determination" xsi:type="CE" />

Because the H7 namespace on the element is scoped and not the default namespec, the xsi:type value MUST also be namespace scoped to hl7.

The xsi:type value should be
xsi:type="hl7:CE"

CC:
Dev : Ensure that the Role and PurposeOfUse has the following values
<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="106328005" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" hl7:codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" hl7:displayName="Social worker" xsi:type=" hl7:CE" />
<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="COVERAGE" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" hl7:codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" hl7:displayName="Disclosures for insurance or disability coverage determination" xsi:type="hl7:CE" />
QA - Run validation suite to ensure the tags are appropriately populated using the server logs.
Run the regression test case related to PurposeOf/For Use.
title: PurposeofUse and Role xsi:type attributes are NOT scoped correctly

description:
The AdminGUI Improvements Wiki page (https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FCPT/Admin+GUI+Improvements) lists a number of fixes that would improve the content, functionality, and usability of the Gateway Administrative Console.

These are fixes related to the Account Management screens. In reference to the Wiki, they are:
* Function item #7
* Visual Defects #10 and #11

CC:
* The "Manage Roles" page replaces the currently existing "Certificate Management" tab under the Account Management section (so that the two tabs are "User Accounts" and "Manage Roles").
* On the "User Accounts" page, the Reset and the Create User buttons have space between them, instead of touching each other. 
* On the "User Accounts" page, the main content area will not have too much space on the sides -- ex., the left side of the "Create User" content box should line up with the highlighted "User Accounts" tab.

NOTE:
Also including the following tweaks --
* Table rows currently have an alternating light-dark pattern, and when the mouse hovers over a table row, it highlights with the dark color.  This highlight has been adjusted so that it is darker than the current dark rows, making it more useful from a visual standpoint.
* On the "User Accounts" page, the Reset and Create User buttons have been restyled to be consistent with other buttons in AdminGUI.
title: AdminGUI Improvements to Address Account Management UI Issues

description:
The AdminGUI Improvements Wiki page (https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FCPT/Admin+GUI+Improvements) lists a number of fixes that would improve the content, functionality, and usability of the Gateway Administrative Console.

These are miscellaneous fixes. In reference to the Wiki, they are:
* Content item #3
* Function items #12 and #14
* Visual Defects #7 and #9

CC:
* Connect Logo appears on Login page.
* Utility nav bar at the top shows a full height (instead of short) border line at the leftmost side -- might have to zoom in to see it.
* Buttons on Gateway Dashboard line up properly.
* In Internet Explorer 8, some text objects on the pages should adjust in size depending on browser window size.

SPECIAL NOTE:
Function item #12 (in the Wiki) is being addressed from a front-end perspective via <meta> tags in the XHTML.  However, the more recommended method is via back-end code by modifying the HTTP headers, as discussed here:  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/49547/making-sure-a-web-page-is-not-cached-across-all-browsers.

CAVEAT:  There are no guarantees that the <meta> tag methods will work (since they cannot control caching done by proxy servers); unfortunately, the recommended method (via back-end code) is not within the scope of this ticket.
title: AdminGUI Improvements to Fix Misc Defects and Add Branding

description:
DoD reached out to the CONNECT team with the following issue they are seeing as they were testing 4.3 with the DIL

We recently did some informal testing of CONNECT 4.3 against the HealtheWay DIL for 2011 specifications. The outbound smoke tests are failing on the DIL because the subject name format and value in the SAML assertion are not following the NwHIN 3.0 specifications. Below is a comparison of the subject name sent from CONNECT 4.3 vs. the DIL. 
 
Did you make a change in CONNECT 4.3 to use NameID vs. Issuer? 
 
Have you tested CONNECT 4.3 against the DIL? 
 
CONNECT subject name
<saml2:NameID Format="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:X509SubjectName">C=US, O=AEGISnetInc, CN=vlerconformance.mantech.com</saml2:NameID>
 
DIL Subject Name
<saml2:Issuer Format="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:X509SubjectName">C=US,O=AEGISnetInc,CN=dilhn003.dil.aegis.net</saml2:Issuer
 
CC:
Investigate issue
title: Support DoD and investigate issue related to SAML Issuer

description:
See CONN-691 for some background. THere are two assertion elements in question here Issuer and the Subject/NameID.  In CONN-691 only the Subject/NameID in the SAML header was fixed to behave as follows -  If a subject name is passed into the gateway on the entity interface(Asertion/userInfo/userName), we should continue to honor that value. If no subject name exists we should parse the distinguished name from the client certificate. 
However the Issuer element under SAML assertion does not utilze the same behavior in that if the entity interface element Assertion/samlIssuer/Issuer does not exist or does not have a value, it still displays the default SamlUser value and not the distinguished name from the certificate

CC:
 If a issuer name is passed into the gateway on the entity interface(Asertion/samlIssuer/issuer), we should continue to honor that value. If no issuer name exists we should parse the distinguished name from the client certificate. 
These changes require a unit test and regression test (you can check for the expected value in an adapter mock service).
title: Default SAML Issuer value being used in all SOAP Header Security sections even though a valid X509SubjectName is defined in the private SSL certificate
